txt.en: You have burned the dwarf-beards kept as trophies by the Shapag-hai.

Shorn dwarf-beards are worn by the Shapag-hai at Lúlstrok in the north-western reaches of the Gladden Fields.\n\nYou have noticed a number of Shapag-hai wearing the beards of slain dwarves as trophies on their armour. You should defeat them and take the dwarf-beards to be burned.

Camp-fires can be found in Lúlstrok in the north-western reaches of the Gladden Fields.\n\nYou have collected a number of shorn dwarf-beards from the Shapag-hai. To keep them out of the hands of the Orcs, you should burn them in a camp-fire at Lúlstrok.
Burn the shorn dwarf-beards in a camp-fire at Lúlstrok
Although Moria remains lost, you have done much to avenge the dwarves slain by the Shapag-hai.
Collected shorn beards from the Shapag-hai at Lúlstrok ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
After reclaiming Moria, the Shapag-hai have taken to wearing the shorn beards of dwarves as trophies.
Collect shorn beards from the Shapag-hai at Lúlstrok

After defeating one of the Shapag-hai at Lúlstrok, you notice a grim trinket hanging loosely from a band around its neck: a shorn dwarf-beard.

The Shapag-hai must have taken trophies from the dwarves they slew in Moria, and they now wear them as a cruel reminder of their victory over the Iron Garrison.

You should reclaim the shorn dwarf-beards from the Shapag-hai and burn them in one of their camp-fires. No dwarf should be forced to endure such an insult!
Collect shorn beards from the Shapag-hai at Lúlstrok ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
